subStages.name: Conduct Stakeholder Interviews
content: Prepare interview questions
Schedule meetings with key stakeholders
Conduct one-on-one or group interviews
Document and summarize interview findings

subStages.name: Analyze Existing Documentation
content: Review project charter and objectives
Examine any existing design documents or prototypes
Study market research and user feedback
Identify relevant industry standards or regulations

subStages.name: Conduct User Research
content: Define user research objectives
Select appropriate research methods (e.g., surveys, focus groups)
Recruit participants
Conduct research sessions and analyze results

subStages.name: Identify Technical Constraints
content: Consult with development team
Review current system architecture
Identify potential technical limitations
Document technical requirements and constraints

subStages.name: Write User Stories
content: Organize a user story writing workshop
Use the standard format: 'As a [user type], I want [action] so that [benefit]'
Ensure each story is independent, negotiable, valuable, estimable, small, and testable
Prioritize user stories based on business value and user needs

subStages.name: Define Acceptance Criteria
content: For each user story, list specific conditions that must be met
Ensure criteria are clear, concise, and testable
Review acceptance criteria with stakeholders
Document acceptance criteria alongside user stories

subStages.name: Create Epic Stories
content: Identify larger, complex features that need to be broken down
Write epic stories to capture high-level requirements
Link related user stories to epics
Prioritize epics within the product backlog

subStages.name: Refine and Groom User Stories
content: Schedule regular backlog grooming sessions
Review and update existing stories
Break down larger stories into smaller, manageable pieces
Ensure stories are ready for upcoming sprints

subStages.name: Determine Prioritization Criteria
content: Define factors for prioritization (e.g., business value, user impact, risk)
Assign weights to each factor
Create a prioritization matrix
Get stakeholder agreement on prioritization approach

subStages.name: Conduct Prioritization Workshop
content: Organize a workshop with key stakeholders
Present backlog items and discuss their importance
Use techniques like MoSCoW (Must have, Should have, Could have, Won't have) or relative prioritization
Document decisions and rationale

subStages.name: Order Backlog Items
content: Arrange items based on prioritization results
Ensure high-priority items are well-defined and ready for development
Review order with Product Owner and get approval
Communicate prioritized backlog to the team

subStages.name: Continuously Refine Priorities
content: Schedule regular backlog review sessions
Adjust priorities based on new information or changing circumstances
Ensure the top of the backlog is always ready for the next sprint
Document changes in priorities and reasons for changes

subStages.name: Choose Estimation Technique
content: Discuss estimation techniques with the team (e.g., story points, t-shirt sizes)
Agree on a common estimation scale
Document the chosen technique and guidelines
Train the team on the selected estimation method

subStages.name: Conduct Estimation Sessions
content: Schedule estimation sessions (e.g., Planning Poker)
Present backlog items to the team
Facilitate discussion and estimation for each item
Record estimates and update the product backlog

subStages.name: Refine Estimates
content: Review and adjust estimates as more information becomes available
Track actual effort spent on completed items
Compare estimates with actuals to improve future estimations
Update estimation guidelines based on learnings

subStages.name: Create Initial Release Plan
content: Group backlog items into potential releases
Estimate timeline based on team velocity and item estimates
Identify dependencies between items and adjust grouping if necessary
Present release plan to stakeholders for feedback and approval

subStages.name: Establish Team's Definition of Done
content: Conduct a workshop to define 'Done' criteria
Include quality standards, testing requirements, and documentation needs
Ensure alignment with organizational and project-specific requirements
Document and display the Definition of Done

subStages.name: Create Done Checklist
content: Develop a checklist based on the Definition of Done
Include items such as code review, testing, documentation, and stakeholder approval
Review checklist with the team and stakeholders
Integrate checklist into the development process

subStages.name: Align Acceptance Criteria with Definition of Done
content: Review user story acceptance criteria
Ensure consistency between story-specific criteria and overall Definition of Done
Adjust acceptance criteria or Definition of Done if necessary
Communicate any changes to the team

subStages.name: Plan for Continuous Improvement
content: Schedule regular reviews of the Definition of Done
Collect feedback on its effectiveness
Identify areas for improvement or refinement
Update the Definition of Done as the project evolves
